snippet: Liked it especially sonce the only bigger supermarket around. Would benefit from more own brand products.
Found the staff to be friendly and helpful, but there were no teabags for my free drink.

I bought plum tomatoes from Sainsburys Cromwell and once I ate them they tasted odd, taste of sour tomatoes that have gone off, even the skin was wrinkely and having strange colors. The side of the pack said please look front of pack for Beat Before Date... The front of the pack had no BBD anywhere to be seen. Is that legal to put rotting tomatoes in packs with no best before date so that pple who don't notice buy them and so they can get rid of a rotting inventory of tomatoes they were going to make a loss on? I'm really concerned about the legality of this? Not only that but I felt ill after with belly aches and signs of intoxication.
Very nice, professional, and helpful staff. Well stocked.

I gave this store two star's as it's all self service most of the time sometimes if you are lucky one person might be on a till but seriously some of the staff need a shower I'm sorry to say one of the guys you just could not go near I am sure managers must know also I asked for purl barley and was sent to the cereals .

One of best Sainsbury's to visit and biggest supermarket around with a big enough car park to always find a spot. A very good choice for lunch with prepared in store meat products and pizza, bread and bakery. 2 hours free parking, Starbuks, Argos, Dentist, pharmacy...etc
Easy to shoping,parking space is always available,easy to get taxi
Service is very very slow... its feels like u r trapped in a noise box and waiting for your ordered food endlessly 😒
Nice place. Lots of parking spots. But there is no Prime KSI here. Not for the last 3 weeks.
It was a quite big store one of the largest format stores and has range of products like fruits bakery and day today routine and clothes and shoes as well

Good variety of products.
However, it seems to assume that everyone is over 5ft  4inch tall. I had to ask other customers to get things off shelves or walk around until I found a  member of staff.

12 min queuing to get change to get a trolley.... ( always a mess with the trolleys upstairs )
It's not the first time, I waited even more in the past !
1 personne ( not smiling and obviously not in a good mood ) has to deal with costumer service tobacco lottery etc....

There is a good selection of products for somewhere in central London. The parking is good, and with both of the lifts now functioning it has become a bit more convenient.

It is however, very outdated inside and looks like a relic from the early 2000's. That itself isn't a problem. The staff that they have are really quite helpful and couldn't say anything more positive about them. It is probably the only reason we choose to shop there.

But this new system which requires us to have a printed receipt to exit is honestly appalling. I don't like the feeling of being locked into the till area because I have to scan my receipt to exit. This itself is enough for me to not come back again and to use Tesco further down the road instead as I don't think customers should be treated like a thief.

As a reminder as well, Sainsbury's were positioned as the second most expensive supermarket behind Waitrose last year and the response by Sainsbury's were that we had to use the nectar card and register all our details if we wanted to receive the previous prices before they imitated Tesco club card system.
Could be a bit quicker on the cashiers. There is no lemonade with normal sugar now, only those bad sweeteners.

Lots of items to choose from, unfortunately they dont carry a lot of american items, like biscuit mix or pancake mix to make biscuits with. They dont have American sausage either. They do have isles of foods from other nations though.

The service here is so lovely. I had a big party over the weekend and had to go back and fourth to this store quiet a lot over the past 2 weeks. The staff there have been exceptional every time. Helping me find what I needed and just during checkout and when I had to exchange some items. Lovely team and a pleasure to visit the store. I hope this message gets back to them!

Stock levels are much better than they used to be. Staff (some) are friendly and helpful. I'm not keen on the ones on the customer service desk. I usually find them grumpy and rude. Linda, on the self-service tills is great though.

I like the new system on the self-service tills, where you need to scan your receipt to exit. I've seen a man walk away from there quickly, as he was walking away, the screen was buffering, then when it stopped, it said his card was declined. I hope it is kept and they don't bow down to customer pressure to keep the gate open. Ultimately, those of us that go there to legimately shop and pay for our shopping, will get hit with higher prices, to cover their losses.

Management need to look again at the abuse of disabled parking and child spaces, which are already so few and few between. For example, Tues 22/4/25, white van occupying disabled space and workers standing around eating lunch. Then they stand gawping across at me watching me park, then scrutinise me walking across the car park entering the store.  It actually puts me off going there as I don't wish to feel intimidated and harassed just going to shop. People need to load up their shopping, then go, not tie up the spaces.

The staff is amazing however what have you done to the layout!
Nothing makes sense!
A huge selection of unhealthy sugary drinks! And lots of items that you do not stock anymore! Like Redbush tea and good quality hummus.
This is a local residential area that needs to stock cooking essentials.
Thanks

Since the store caved in to Euro Car Parks who cut parking from 2hr to 1hr ...which is certainly not enough for a family shop or for the elderly given there's now only 1 lift to the store and it takes forever to go a few feet    (don't use it if you have any form of claustrophobia) the experience is abysmal.Fines galore and Sainsbury's can't even be bothered to arrange a ticket redemption system for their customers as other stores do.
They do have a good selection of products but the store looks tired and dilapidated.
Maybe they are thinking of selling the site and can't be bothered any more.
Can you read the sign in the pic below ?
It’s a supermarket. They have groceries here. Like bread, butter and toilet paper. It doesn’t need to be rated
Liked it especially sonce the only bigger supermarket around. Would benefit from more own brand products.
Found the staff to be friendly and helpful, but there were no teabags for my free drink.

I bought plum tomatoes from Sainsburys Cromwell and once I ate them they tasted odd, taste of sour tomatoes that have gone off, even the skin was wrinkely and having strange colors. The side of the pack said please look front of pack for Beat Before Date... The front of the pack had no BBD anywhere to be seen. Is that legal to put rotting tomatoes in packs with no best before date so that pple who don't notice buy them and so they can get rid of a rotting inventory of tomatoes they were going to make a loss on? I'm really concerned about the legality of this? Not only that but I felt ill after with belly aches and signs of intoxication.
Very nice, professional, and helpful staff. Well stocked.

I gave this store two star's as it's all self service most of the time sometimes if you are lucky one person might be on a till but seriously some of the staff need a shower I'm sorry to say one of the guys you just could not go near I am sure managers must know also I asked for purl barley and was sent to the cereals .

One of best Sainsbury's to visit and biggest supermarket around with a big enough car park to always find a spot. A very good choice for lunch with prepared in store meat products and pizza, bread and bakery. 2 hours free parking, Starbuks, Argos, Dentist, pharmacy...etc
Easy to shoping,parking space is always available,easy to get taxi
Service is very very slow... its feels like u r trapped in a noise box and waiting for your ordered food endlessly 😒
Nice place. Lots of parking spots. But there is no Prime KSI here. Not for the last 3 weeks.
It was a quite big store one of the largest format stores and has range of products like fruits bakery and day today routine and clothes and shoes as well

Good variety of products.
However, it seems to assume that everyone is over 5ft  4inch tall. I had to ask other customers to get things off shelves or walk around until I found a  member of staff.

12 min queuing to get change to get a trolley.... ( always a mess with the trolleys upstairs )
It's not the first time, I waited even more in the past !
1 personne ( not smiling and obviously not in a good mood ) has to deal with costumer service tobacco lottery etc....

There is a good selection of products for somewhere in central London. The parking is good, and with both of the lifts now functioning it has become a bit more convenient.

It is however, very outdated inside and looks like a relic from the early 2000's. That itself isn't a problem. The staff that they have are really quite helpful and couldn't say anything more positive about them. It is probably the only reason we choose to shop there.

But this new system which requires us to have a printed receipt to exit is honestly appalling. I don't like the feeling of being locked into the till area because I have to scan my receipt to exit. This itself is enough for me to not come back again and to use Tesco further down the road instead as I don't think customers should be treated like a thief.

As a reminder as well, Sainsbury's were positioned as the second most expensive supermarket behind Waitrose last year and the response by Sainsbury's were that we had to use the nectar card and register all our details if we wanted to receive the previous prices before they imitated Tesco club card system.
Could be a bit quicker on the cashiers. There is no lemonade with normal sugar now, only those bad sweeteners.

Lots of items to choose from, unfortunately they dont carry a lot of american items, like biscuit mix or pancake mix to make biscuits with. They dont have American sausage either. They do have isles of foods from other nations though.

The service here is so lovely. I had a big party over the weekend and had to go back and fourth to this store quiet a lot over the past 2 weeks. The staff there have been exceptional every time. Helping me find what I needed and just during checkout and when I had to exchange some items. Lovely team and a pleasure to visit the store. I hope this message gets back to them!

Stock levels are much better than they used to be. Staff (some) are friendly and helpful. I'm not keen on the ones on the customer service desk. I usually find them grumpy and rude. Linda, on the self-service tills is great though.

I like the new system on the self-service tills, where you need to scan your receipt to exit. I've seen a man walk away from there quickly, as he was walking away, the screen was buffering, then when it stopped, it said his card was declined. I hope it is kept and they don't bow down to customer pressure to keep the gate open. Ultimately, those of us that go there to legimately shop and pay for our shopping, will get hit with higher prices, to cover their losses.

Management need to look again at the abuse of disabled parking and child spaces, which are already so few and few between. For example, Tues 22/4/25, white van occupying disabled space and workers standing around eating lunch. Then they stand gawping across at me watching me park, then scrutinise me walking across the car park entering the store.  It actually puts me off going there as I don't wish to feel intimidated and harassed just going to shop. People need to load up their shopping, then go, not tie up the spaces.

This is a local residential area that needs to stock cooking essentials.
